Name: Azure DevOps Services
Developed or used CDE: Azure DevOps Services Microsoft Visual Studio
Notes: Most features are free for open source projects or teams of 5 members or less

Name: Bitbucket
Developed or used CDE: Atlassian BitBucket Server, JIRA and Confluence
Notes: Denies service to Cuba, Iran, North Korea, Sudan, Syria

Name: Buddy
Notes: Cloud version free for 1 project with no limit on size. Self-hosted version free up to 10 users with Fair Source license applied.

Name: Gitea
Notes: Gitea is an open-source software tool funded on Open Collective that is designed for self-hosting, but also provides a free first-party instance.

Name: GForge
Developed or used CDE: Cloud version – free up to 5 users. On-premises version - free up to 5 users.
Notes: GForge is free for open source projects.

Name: GitHub
Notes: Denies Service to Crimea, Cuba, Iran, North Korea, Sudan, Syria List of government takedown requests: [1]

Name: GitLab
Developed or used CDE: GitLab Community Edition (CE) — free software GitLab Enterprise Edition (EE) — proprietary
Notes: Denies Service to Crimea, Cuba, Iran, North Korea, Sudan, Syria

Name: GNU Savannah
Notes: Project by the Free Software Foundation and projects with a GPL compatible license. Staff must approve requests for project approval, deletion, and so forth, which can take time if staffing levels are low. Code access review

Name: Helix TeamHub
Developed or used CDE: Cloud version – free up to 5 users. On-premises version requires a license.
Notes: Free cloud version has no limits on projects within 5gb storage limit. On-premises version has DevOps pipeline technology and free replicas.

Name: Launchpad
Notes: Supports Bazaar and Git for version-controlled repository hosting.

Name: Ourproject.org
Notes: For free software, free culture and free content projects.

Name: Rosetta Code
Notes: Programming chrestomathy wiki for common algorithms

Name: SourceForge
Notes: For open-source projects only. Denies service when accessed from Cuba, Iran, North Korea, Sudan, Syria
